Text.Value: These are masterworks. Perhaps you'll join their ranks, once I repurpose your corpse.
Rancid donkey scrotum! The quakes herald the shadows - it's already too late!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: continues from a cinematic node in which a shadowquake interrupts the dialogue - the quake continues as background noise. If possible visualisation of dust falling might help to sell it.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sudden angry, alarmed outburst. There's an attack imminent

Text.Value: Come join me and find out. I want to look at you with my own eyes.
Stinking pile of ogre afterbirth! The quakes herald the shadows - they've found me!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: continues from a cinematic node in which a shadowquake interrupts the dialogue - the quake continues as background noise. If possible visualisation of dust falling might help to sell it.
EditorData.NodeContext: Sudden angry, alarmed outburst. There's an attack imminent

Text.Value: You prowl my battleground - why? Are you friend? Foe? Thieving scavenger?
Who am I really speaking to?
No. I will accept a gift from you instead. Raw materials.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The skeleton looks the player up and down briefly, like an appraisal.

A deep rumble rises from below. The surrounding ruins tremble as if experiencing an earthquake. Characters in the scene should react, with apprehension, but if possible a wider shot to emphasise the scale of the temple as the quake rumbles through it.
EditorData.SFXTags: [MD] Laurge rumbling sound as if an earthquake has started. The whole temple is quaking
EditorData.VFXTags: [MD] As the temple begins to rumble, we should see dust and rubble falling to emphasise it.

Text.Value: Z'rell sent me, looking for someone called Balthazar.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN only if Z'rell sent the player to look for Balthazar.

Text.Value: I'm no friend of yours - whatever you are.
Attack.
Did she now? Enter - I will see if I have any use for you.
Afraid I'd ruin these things' looks? Make good on your threat, or else stand aside.
Hurry inside, or your racket is liable to -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Skeleton on alert, weapon raised, glancing around at the environs while speaking to the player
EditorData.NodeContext: On alert, urgent. Line is cut off as the skeleton notices something. (full line would have been 'liable to draw attention')

Text.Value: *You feel a tremble rising from the floor, growing stronger...*

EditorData.SFXTags: [MD] The player hears the beginnings of the rumbling

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Intentionally empty - in the rare case a summon triggers this dialog we just want to show the Shadowquake cinematic. Empty Greeting node will be skipped

Text.Value: Ah. A friend - an uninvited friend. I did not request help.
Attack.
*You find yourself in a dead, putrid skull - somehow hosting a tadpole amongst a squirm of maggots. Another presence lurks within, manipulating the corpse like a puppet.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld FX. The player winces at the pain of a mindmeld. The skeleton has no visible reaction.

Text.Value: Hot blood and bluster. But perhaps I can use you.
A misunderstanding. Please, accept my apologies.
Not a friend, perhaps, but an ally. Or a servant. I saw within you - we share common purpose.
I can do little with an apology. But you... I may have a use for you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The skeleton looks the player up and down briefly, like an appraisal.
The rumbling of the shadowquake intensifies and reaches its peak. All the light sources in the vicinity are suddenly extinguished. Rifts tear open in the floor. Dark Justiciar wraiths emerge.
EditorData.SFXTags: [MD] Quaking crescendos, All lights in the room are extinguished. A rift opens in the floor and a dark justiciar emerges
EditorData.VFXTags: [MD] Quaking crescendos, All lights in the room are extinguished. A rift opens in the floor and a dark justiciar emerges

Text.Value: My creations are my pride and joy. I shall kill you for attacking them.

Synopsis: The player is challenged by some skeleton warriors at a barricade outside the Necromancer's lair. The necromancer speaks through the dead warriors - his words in their dessicated voices.(this mayor may not follow on from an earlier scene with more skeletons controlled by the necromancer). A mindmeld convinces the necromancer to command his skeletons to grant entry. The scene ends with combat with the skeletons, or a shadowquake triggering a fight between player (+ skeletons) against sharran wraiths. Afterwards, the player is invited into Balthazar's inner sanctum.
